Articles.Content:
I was scrolling through Wikipedia a few minutes ago and noticed that Jool's moon Bop looks *very* similar to Mars's largest moon Phobos. Now I guess we know where the inspiration for this body came from! They are both brownish lumpy potatoes with frequent valleys and hills, and both have massive craters with white rays.

Image of Phobos:

![mars-moon-phobos-500.png](http://mars.nasa.gov/images/mep/allaboutmars/mars-moon-phobos-500.png)

Bop from a similar angle:

![BUrhL5V.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/BUrhL5V.jpg)

Yeah, perhaps. Anyway, it's clear that Ike is nothing like the moons of Mars.

Phobos is almost big enough to be round under the influence of its own gravity, but not quite.
